caption: It’s a nice place to hang out and take pictures. No need to take tickets to go up the escalator to the top floor. You need tickets to access any other floor. The Stravinsky fountain was pretty cool. We did not have the time to explore the art museum but I am sure it will be amazing.

One of the best views of Paris, you can experience here. Not only view, but also history and geography. You need to pay to enter but you won't regret it. In case you're tired, there are a couple of cafe/restaurants in the area, or you can just seat outside on the floor.
Exciting museums that I have visited in Paris for a long time. The collection of modern arts is beautifully categorized. I liked the unique architecture

Very big local library and art center. You can see the whole Paris view at the top, there is a restaurant if want to enjoy the view and sip your cocktail. The library has everything you need: variety of books for your study, computers, video games, records, even video records. You can also check the old newspapers. It is free of charge except the art museums. Totally recommended.

The Centre Pompidou is an absolute must-visit for any art and culture enthusiast! The unique architecture, with its exposed pipes and industrial design, makes it one of the most recognizable landmarks in Paris. Inside, the collection of modern and contemporary art is vast and inspiring, featuring works from some of the greatest artists of our time.  I came across an abstract artwork featuring a bold combination of red and blue with circular accents. This striking piece feels both minimalistic and expressive. It’s a wonderful example of how simplicity can evoke powerful emotions and spark different interpretations.  I also appreciated the library and public spaces, which make the center feel welcoming and accessible. It’s truly a place where art meets innovation and creativity, and I’d highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city!
Awesome exterior with cool art installations. For the 2nd time we didnt manage to get it. Lines were massive! You have to reserve tickets way in advance

That's of course very subjective, but I'm not a fan of the architecture inside the building. Don't get me wrong, I do like the general architectural concept, I just don't think that the architecture in the exhibition rooms should distract from the artworks that are shown. And I think it does exactly that and even worse, it diminishes their effect on the viewer.  The collection itself is phenomenal and you have a great view of the city from the escalators and the terraces

Visited on our last full day in Paris. Other than a clearly unhappy/unhelpful cashier getting tickets,  we enjoyed this interesting museum/multicultural complex. We got to see some very interesting art and some very unusual art. One piece made me think of Beetlejuice, and I had to send it to someone I know who loves that movie.  Great place to visit. The only downside is the lockers... most were out of order, and it was a little confusing.  Luckily,  the attendant was very helpful, although he could have used some help.

Once of the best culture centre I seen full of everything to do with France museum library very extensive a very large study area for students ample facilities cafe exhibition very well planned out always busy most mornings ques to get in

The venue is great for exhibitions. The view over Paris on the upper floors is great. The temporary exhibition for Surrealismus that we visited was fantastic. Alas, the permanent exhibition can't keep up with that.

Long lines at weekends, so it's better to book in advance.  The lockers are free, so leave your bags and enjoy your visit. You choose a green locker and enter a 4-digit code of your choice. Remember to cover your code with your hand so nearby people don't see your code.  We went to the Surrealism exhibition and it was far too busy so it was difficult to enjoy the art. The permanent collection was less crowded and enjoyable.  Wonderful art in a beautiful building - well worth a visit.

Great experience as always. Unfortunately I was disappointed to find out that you sell unsafe items in your gift shop. I bought this candle holder and was so happy to use it on the follow up to Christmas. Luckily I noticed that the plastic burnt completely and managed to take out the candle in time before it causes serious damage. FYI

Quite a few galleries closed, however it was interesting to see. The comic book installation was very nice. A few great sculptures and beautiful paintings see my pictures for my favourites. Tickets start from around 12.45euro
A must see for anyone interested in art. The center is also suitable for children and families. There are many interesting cafes, shops and bakeries in the surrounding area.
Fabulous world of art, an iconic building with fabulous display spaces and great spaces to just be in and relax. Plus, amazing views over Paris.
A cool center and area of art and culture. The building looks very special. Don't miss it and plan for a short break at this place.

I'm a lover of art and exhibitions so I had to come to the Centre Pompidou. The architecture is amazing, it's full of light, and you're able to see the inside from the outside, it's a unique building. I thought the Pompidou would be incredibly busy but there were about 5 queues outside, all empty. I was able to go in without a ticket and go to the Nike exhibition which was exquisite. The Centre Pompidou does a number of exhibitions in a year and they are usually really interesting and thought provoking. The staff are lovely, able to speak a number of languages so if you need help, they will look after you. If you're in Paris, you have to go to the Centre Pompidou, you will not be disappointed.
Good to get in here once more, they’re pulling it down and housing the collection somewhere else because the financial model doesn’t work. The permanent collection of modern art is terrific.

This beacon of modernity looks and feels quite old and tired. It’s being renovated for years now, and is teeming with loads of people: tourists, art-lovers and students. Its world class permanent collection presents a thorough look on 20th century modern up to today’s contemporary art. By paying a small extra you get a ticket to see all the numerous temporary exhibitions on the rest of the levels.

The Centre Pompidou in Paris is a must-visit for art enthusiasts and architecture lovers alike. Its vast collection of modern and contemporary art is both diverse and thought-provoking, showcasing works by some of the most influential artists of the 20th and 21st centuries.  The building itself, with its iconic “inside-out” design, is an architectural marvel. But the highlight of the visit is undoubtedly the panoramic view from the top floor.  Overlooking the rooftops of Paris, with stunning vistas of landmarks like the Eiffel Tower and Sacré-Cœur, the view is simply breathtaking. A truly enriching experience that blends art, architecture, and unforgettable cityscapes.

My absolute favorite place in Paris 😍  Completely blown away by the Pompidou 🥹😭❤️‍🔥 I’ve been dreaming of visiting this place for over a decade, and it did not disappoint.  A psychedelic machine as humanistic architecture—inside-out, transparent, flexible, futuristic, a real-life homage to Archigram’s concepts. A building that evokes curiosity, a perfect house for the cultivation of culture. Their permanent collections are an exciting range of modern and contemporary art and architecture, alongside some marvelous temporary programs like the current Comics and Surrealism exhibitions. Thailand’s very own Apichatpong has films and installations currently displaying too! Fantastic curation, equipped with interactive chat features that allows you to learn more about major artworks on your phone.  Plus the view of Paris and the Eiffel Tower from the top floors is phenomenal, even on a cloudy evening.  Top-tier cultural space and experience. 10/10 👏🏼  I recommend booking your ticket online ahead of time to skip the line. I got in right away on a Sunday evening 😊

Visiting the museum late in the evening and missed the chance to participate the family workshop. Can get great view at the top floors and also have a handy of Japanese cartoon in one of their exhibits.

It’s our first time visiting the Pompidou Center, and I’m in love with it. The Surrealism exhibition is incredible, and the view from the 5th floor, where you can see all of Paris, is breathtaking. I wish I had visited sooner!

Centre Pompidou is a truly unique experience that stands out in the Parisian art scene. The building itself is an architectural masterpiece, with its iconic inside-out design and colorful pipes. The museum houses an impressive collection of contemporary and modern art, including works by Picasso, Kandinsky, and Duchamp, alongside thought-provoking temporary exhibitions.  The layout is spacious, and the top floor offers stunning panoramic views of Paris, including the Eiffel Tower and Sacré-Cœur. I recommend taking your time to explore every level and enjoying a coffee at the rooftop café.  Be sure to book tickets in advance to skip the line, as it can get quite crowded. All in all, a fantastic destination for anyone interested in exploring the evolution of 20th and 21st-century art.

Recommended only for modern art lovers, the rest of us should revisit the Louvre. We went to the Brancusi exhibition, which was very well organized and included many important works of the artist as well as the history of him. Wouldn’t revisit but was definitely worth it, especially if you have already done the other Paris-must sees. The building is interesting, however it stands out because it is different, not because it’s beautiful. Also buildings with structural elements exposed to the weather are maintenance intensive or rather a maintenance nightmare. Surely very educational and makes you appreciate even more all the architectural jewels of this majestic city.

The museum's avant-garde architecture, with its distinctive exposed structural elements and vibrant color-coded pipes, sets the tone for the innovative art housed within. The extensive collection of modern and contemporary art is impressive, featuring masterpieces from renowned artists such as Picasso, Kandinsky, and Duchamp. The temporary exhibitions are equally compelling, offering fresh and thought-provoking perspectives. Additionally, the panoramic views of Paris from the rooftop are breathtaking. Overall, The Centre Pompidou is a must-visit for art enthusiasts and those looking to explore the cutting edge of cultural expression.

Great modern inside out building.  Blue for air flows (air-conditioning) Yellow for electricity. Green for water circuits. Red for pedestrian flow (escalators and lifts). I especially enjoyed the permanent collection museum and Restaurant George on the 6th floor.  You get an amazing view of the city.

The surrealism exhibition was absolutely fantastic. Such a large and varied collection. The halls were packed with people making viewing a little challenging, but it also showed society's appetite for the surreal, which was interesting. The main gallery had a wonderful range of modern art, beautifully installed and clustered in themes. The building is modern and impressive, with tubes containing escalators, like hamster tubes. The views of the city from the top were breathtaking.

Wonderful free view of Paris on the 5th floor. No ticket at all required for the view.  If you have the Paris Museum Pass head to the time slot line they are currently letting in, don't stay in the no ticket line.  There was a good variety of styles a.d artists. If you like modern art, go for it. For you it is worth the admission. If you aren't a fan? Skip the museum and check out the view.

Museum pass works here. Pompidou is weird because you actually can get into the building for free. This includes the bookshops and being able to get the view of the city. It’s the gallery itself that is ticketed. It’s not the best set up of a museum in Paris and we ended up missing rooms (major areas) because of it. Some very cool art though including a Frida! There are escalators so don’t be intimidated by the stairs you can see from outside the building.

We wanted to see this museum before it closes for the next 5 years. You don't even have to buy a ticket to see the most amazing views of Paris at the top of the building and right out in front. If you want, you can pay a small price to see some Modern art on 2 floors that are actually pretty cool. (Not a Modern Art fan here). Go on their late night so you can see everything as well as watch the sun set on Paris. Beautiful!!! They also have a small dining area and multiple gift shops to keep everyone happy. Get here before its too late!!
Absolutely love this museum, it’s my favourite place in Paris, and everything is magic the structure and the location.

This was our first time visiting, even though we have been to Paris 4 times.  The building is absolutely spectacular and the panoramic views of Paris where you are able to view almost every iconic landmark is worth the visit alone.  The special exhibition was Brancusi and this was great.  After walking through the main halls of the museum we realised that modern art is probably not as much our vibe as we thought and we do prefer the classics.  Having said that, we were so happy that we visited and were able to see original artworks by modern day artists.  Well worth a visit.  We spent 2.5 hours exploring.

Easily the best museum I’ve ever been to. The art and the building itself are wonderful and unlike anything I’ve experienced. Only deducted a star because we saw an employee in the cafeteria yell and curse at someone for something that didn’t warrant such behavior.
Great exhibition about surealism. 25 minute line for tickets and then 30 minute wait to enter Gallery 1. But worth the wait.

My last visit to the Centre Pompidou was more than 15 years ago, so I had forgotten what a great modern art collection they have. It's certainly worth a visit. The building is magnificent and the panoramic view of Paris is great. I'd recommend to buy your entrance tickets in advance.

Really enjoyed to visit this iconic building in the center of 4th arrondissement of Paris. This is the best  and important place for contemporary art. You can also access the library for free and enjoy the rooftop amazing views of Paris city.
One of the best Comic Exhibitions i have ever seen. Loved every little second of my little nerd life.
